website_summaries.verdict: A quality, high-performance jump rope that won't break the bank.
pros: Construction, durability, and performance comparable to more expensive models

customer_reviews.title: Works great but be warned...
customer_reviews.text: You wanna jump over some rope? This rope swings around and you can jump right over it. You can jump fast, you can jump slow, you can even jump fancy. This rope will keep swinging and you can keep jumping. But, BEWARE! This rope does NOT forgive. If you mess up by miss-timing a jump, this rope will punish you. This rope is basically made of a steel cable with a very thin coating of plastic. When it hits you, you will feel a sting like the whip of Satan and it leaves you with a mark both physically and emotionally. This jump rope fosters a real punishment avoidance-type of cardio training.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Friese

customer_reviews.title: I don’t care for it =(
customer_reviews.text: Very thin rubber coated cable, lightweight and difficult to jump at any length. I jump rope well and feel I can jump just about anything but after many attempts, adjustments, different shoes, I gave up on this. My roommate had the same experience with it so I am returning it. =(
customer_reviews.author: LMiller

customer_reviews.title: one of the ends shot out like a bullet during mid-jump 2) Most concerning of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this thing has such high stars. 1) Broken after first use, one of the ends shot out like a bullet during mid-jump 2) Most concerning of the issues is the a stray metal wire sticking out (shown in pic) in the middle of the rope. I felt something cut my leg and when examining the rope, the sharp barb punctured my thumb. Amazon users: Please beware of poor quality material and poor engineering. Use at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: we're off to see the wizard

customer_reviews.title: Broke After 10 Minutes
customer_reviews.text: Everything was going great until it broke, roughly 10 minutes into using it. All of a sudden, one of the medal bearings from one handle broke off. I held onto the rope and continued to jump, expecting to fix it after I finished. I could not find the medal bearing and figured I'd superglue it back or something. However, during the very next set a minute later the other handle broke. I now use the rope by itself without the handles, which actually isn't terrible. However, it is clear that the quality of this jump rope is subpar, to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: anonymousbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Almost like a burning candle
customer_reviews.text: At the start, this product exceeded my expectations as a speed rope. After 2 months of vigorous speed jumping, the outer plastic coating had worn down, exposing the metal wire inside. This in return caused the metal wire to wear down, to eventually become two seperate pieces... I'm certainly no monster, but I had also hoped it could withstand torture from an active person.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: broke during first use
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time i used it. meaning when i missed and stepped on it (i weigh 115lbs so im small) the rubber cap at the end of the rope popped off and flew into the abyss of the parking lot i was working out in, looks like it wouldn't last for long anyway. it's literally a wire encased in plastic so if you do exercise outside it probably wont last for long. also hurts when you do miss. will be buying something better
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Not a good rope.
customer_reviews.text: While the customer service is fantastic, unfortunately the same can't be said for the jump rope. Handle and screws flew off on the very first go where I lost them. Even lost the extra tips/screws that it came with cause they continued to fly off. Even after I tightened the last of the what I had left, still came apart. It's also extremely long and hits your feet every time you try to jump. Got to the point where it slowed down my workout and just threw it away. The $10 wasn't worth having to stop my rhythm and momentum of exercising. If I could get my money back, I wouldn't even hesitate to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrot Fusco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, lightweight and simple but not for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: These are actually very nice jump ropes. Very simple build with very light weight materials in terms of both the handles and rope but very effective. I took very well to them because of it's light weight and it makes a really cool sound because of the thin wire/rope when in use. The only negative, and it's a big one, is that it's not designed for outdoor, ie concrete, use. Mine wore out in a week with daily usage. The plastic coating came off really fast, exposing the wire underneath. Because of that, I'm returning it. However, if you're looking for a jump rope to use in the gym with a carpeted or padded floor, I would easily recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NF

customer_reviews.title: Wire coating peels off and started to tangle. Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I jump daily for boxing doing double unders and other tricks. I've always jumped on rubber mats and gym surfaces and never on concrete; the coating on the rope started to come off exposing the metal wire. Metal wire began to have a tangled shape that constantly snagged and catch my feet whenever jumping. Emailed customer support for a replacement rope but never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Sundah Wong

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these ropes to use during my workouts in between weight training sets. Didn't need anything fancy, just something to use for 10 minutes a day, 3 days a week. After I adjusted it I took it to the gym and sadly after only 30 seconds the handle broke and sent the silver screw and parts flying across the gym. The next day I tried the other one and this time I accidentally stepped on the rope (as expected) and the handle broke, sending screws flying. I WANT A REFUND!!! THIS SHOULD NOT HAPPEN even if the rope was only $10.
customer_reviews.author: Sashyboops

customer_reviews.title: There are some good things about this product
customer_reviews.text: There are some good things about this product. It is well designed and comes with a bag, so it does not get tangled. It is also a speed rope, but the plastic connector snapped within less than two weeks of using it. A metal connector would have stood the test of time and would have well been worth the extra dollar. Thankfully it was within the warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: gdouglas

customer_reviews.title: Future Black Belt
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the jump rope I was looking for! Within minutes of opening the package, I had my new jump rope adjusted and was enjoying it. It's very light weight and easy to handle. They set me free Double Unders instructions on PDF which I thought was great. I just got started back into jumping rope when I started Tae Kwon Do classes a few months ago at age 54. Having the ability to do tricks makes jumping rope more fun and challenging for me. I had a traumatic brain injury in 2002 so it's great for re-building my coordination.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Small, Light, Functions
customer_reviews.text: The aesthetic is nice, black with the metal silver peeking out. Adjusting the length is intuitive, if a bit clumsily done. There is a lot of length which is nice for adjusting, but there is nowhere to put that extra rope and it falls about. Maybe someone else has figured out a way to hide it but I have not. It is a small thing, not deal-breaking. The handles are light and plastic, at this price point it is more than adequate. There is also a small carrying bag and stickers! That was really nice, especially the bag if you want to take them with you to the gym or something.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Nice rope for speed jumping
customer_reviews.text: This a great speed jump rope. Keep in mind this isn't a traditional jump rope - it's specifically for speed jumping (like the way boxers train). Definitely not the schoolyard jump rope we remember. The cable is long so you need to adjust it for your height. These are the best features: - Nice sized handles, fits most hands (you don't want huge handles anyway) - Handles rotate easily - Cable isn't too light; makes for easy rotations - Comes with spare screw kit Definitely recommend this rope for speed jumping enthusiasts. Remember this is a SPEED rope not a SKIPPING rope - be aware of the difference and make a smart purchasing choice! - -
customer_reviews.author: SavvyShopper

customer_reviews.title: This sucks.
customer_reviews.text: From the first use, the little screw to adjust the size of the rope kept coming loose. I didn't mind to continue tightening it, but yesterday I was mid jump and the screw flew off into the abyss of my yard never to be seen again. I've only been using it for a month. This sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Meep Meep

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: The rope was little but too long, so I adjusted to fit my style as you can see in the picture, But the problem is you can also easily hurt yourself when you spin the rope since there is unused wire on the other side. I tried to cut the wire, but it is soo hard to cut it with scissor or knife, you need to have a wire cutter to cut it, Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Jian

customer_reviews.title: The reviews on this jump rope looked pretty good despite a few negative ones
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this jump rope looked pretty good despite a few negative ones. Unfortunately, the rope falls into the junk category. No joke, 30 seconds into jump roping, the metal bracket holding the cable to the right handle broke. The piece shot somewhere and I couldn't find it to even attempt fixing it. Yes, it was affordable, but at least it should work for a few times before breaking. Premium quality? I think not. Come on. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: K. Neuharth

customer_reviews.title: Average Jump Rope
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this product two times. The first time, I had used it on some concrete which immediately caused the cable to degrade. Eventually the cable was frayed enough to where it started to get caught in my clothes - not good. The second time, after buying a mat to protect the rope, a handle just fell apart. The rope itself is fine, but then pieces holding the handle together just came apart. I'm not impressed. Pros Lightweight, Super Easy to get a fast speed going Cons Durability - I don't think this is meant as a daily workout jump rope (definitely don't use it on concrete)
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: 50% chance
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for me and one for my wife. I love mine and it works just fine. Even survived my quiting smoking. I was angry at everything and the jump.rope took a beating. Not proud of it but to let you know one survived pissed off nicotine withdrawal. My wife's on the other hand lasted for about 4 double unders before it decided to explode and break on her. Unfixable, me and a couple.other people tried to fix it to no avail. Ended up.getting her a 5billion rope instead. So there you have it, this will either last you a lifetime or 4 jumps. It's pretty much a coin flip. If its good.its good if it's bad its bad.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality - don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This jump rope was terrible quality. After one use, almost all of the plastic had came off, leaving just the wiring. After several more uses, the handles would no longer stay on and the screws and plastic tips would go flying off of the end of the rope. I am extremely disappointed by this item and feel like I wasted my time and money with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This jump rope kinda sucks. I never really got to jump with it well. It's way too long so you have to adjust the length but i didn't like the extra rope hanging behind the ends because it throws off the equilibrium of the rope while jumping. Then the tip came off one side so the metal clasp fell off and got loss. So i tried to knot the end so the handle wouldn't fall off but the plastic is too thick to hold a tight knot. All in all it was miserable from the start. I like the cheap plastic one much better that might gym has. Sometimes fancier is not better.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeta

customer_reviews.title: JUNK. Broke after 5 uses. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible model. I’ve used this jump rope about 5 times and the screw went flying some where. The rope can’t be used without this peice so I contacted the company twice to use the warranty. I keep getting the run around and still no replacement. Frustrating. I suggest you buy a different type of jump rope.
customer_reviews.author: Lmeast Slacka

customer_reviews.title: Not A Fan
customer_reviews.text: A jump rope is a jump rope is a jump rope right? I would normally say sure but this type of design with the rope doesn't feel as fluid as my others. Yes, it works. However, my biggest issue with this is the design with how the rope attaches to the handle. Just my experience with using this style is it doesn't feel as smooth and kind of clunky. Will keep as a backup rope if needed. Overall i would say this seems to work for many others just for myself I didn't like the design.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua G

customer_reviews.title: This rope's not just ornamental!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great hanging on my wall, and takes up less space than a stationary bike. Makes people think I exercise. Sometimes I hang it on the doorknob of the front door (outside), so the neighbors and mailman think I cross-fit. Holds up well to the elements. Ballbearings are impressively smooth. Adjustment was simple, and the screwclamps allow you to test a length before you cut the rope. Super thin, super fast, super close to tripples.
customer_reviews.author: Creep in the Cellar

customer_reviews.title: I TRASHED IT ON MY SECOND TRY! Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worse rope I have ever bought. It's design that allows you to adjust the length of the rope is flawed because the screws that allow you to adjust the length loosen in time and you end up with a full length rope anyways. Additionally the weight of the rope itself does not allow for a high impact, high speed jump routine. The rope lags in speed and gets caught as you step into position precisely because it is going slower than your pace. I was so irritated after several tries that I just trashed it. Definitely not a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners to pro
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust Spins easy Surprisngly small and light weight. The handle is a bit short for me, but Ill still use it. I like the adjustability of it. I have only used it once for a 20min session. If I have problemish I will come back and adjust my review and let you know. For the price this is a good value. Handle is plastic. Cord is some sort of flexible plastic, not sure how it will handle on concrete..we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Attilla

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, with a personal touch
customer_reviews.text: The handles are lighter than I expected and the hardware is simple and easy to use. I am an average height male and was able to make a small adjustment using only the hardware on the rope itself to make it fit me perfectly. No cutting was required. It is a really excellent thing that they include an addition set of hardware - I guess in case you lose or damage what comes on the handle/rope itself. I received a personalized email thanking me for my purchase and I get these sense from the communications that the company truly cares about solving my fitness needs through providing tools and service that exceed expectations. I am impressed and grateful I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: KennyD

customer_reviews.title: Big ass Broke the Handle
customer_reviews.text: Being that I bought these to workout with at my crossfit gym, I needed something that could take a beating and didn't cost a fortune either. I was fairly fond of the jump rope until I stepped on a handle. It was the second time I had stepped on a handle (which both times I noticed and didn't put all my weight on it) and it broke. I think the rope portion (coated in some type of vinyl plastic) definitely held up and was great. It didn't even tangle either after I'd had thrown them around the gym floor and my gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: TravellerNamed Jay

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I jump rope quite a often, and this rope is very awkward to use. The cable system interrupts your jumps because the cable constantly hits your hands while turning. The rope also hurts when you are jumping fast and it smacks your foot. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: transporter

customer_reviews.title: Would be great for indoor use but I used mine out on ...
customer_reviews.text: Would be great for indoor use but I used mine out on the sidewalk and the cable got pretty roughed up after about 5 minutes. I wasn't expecting that, but I'm sure it holds up better if you're using it indoors. It's definitely a speed rope, very lightweight and won't need any "breaking-in" after being wound up and shipped. Other than it getting all chewed up on the pavement, I think it's a good product at a fair price!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality & price is right
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality rope, especially for the price. I had just been looking for a simple rope to use for home workouts, and this was an excellent deal, especially for the price. I love how easy it is to adjust the length for your height. The one thing I'll say is if you're as clumsy as I am, you might not want to use this bare footed. I've hit the top of my foot with this once or twice, and BOY does it hurt (leaves a welt too). I'm honestly not sure if that's common among speed ropes as I've never owned one before, but something to watch out for.
customer_reviews.author: That's So Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. The length is super easy to set and it is quick. You can go at slow or really fast speeds with this cable and it does not kink. Do not hit yourself though on accident...it can hurt. If it gets a little twisted the way it is mounted on the handles with the ball bearings allows for it to easily spin back into place. I have nothing negative to say about it so far. I have had it for a couple weeks now and make sure I hit 1000 jump ropes a day for starters. Day 1 I was horrible, now I expect to get to 100 each try. Buy it, you will like it!
customer_reviews.author: The Rubenstein’s

customer_reviews.title: Hand tighten the screws before EVERY workout or it could come apart and have metal hardware fly everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Okay I seriously LOVE these jump ropes. I've been using mine for almost a YEAR and it's still going great. The ball bearings make all the difference and if you're looking so speed and smoothness, this is it! It looks good and it comes with a carrying pouch, which I use to carry my wallet and keys and the gym. TOP TIP: Tighten the screws before every workout! It will get loose over time and the rope and handle will separate with the hardware flying off into some random corner. Had this happen to me just once but fortunately, this product comes with EXTRA hardware for such emergencies! Overall, very solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Good quality jump rope
customer_reviews.text: 1st jump rope I have used in over 20 years. Wanted to add one into my workout routine. Small, lightweight and travels well. Handles are durable plastic (dropped and squished several times, no damage) with smooth rotation. Collars are easy to adjust without tools. Cable is coated and very durable. Was not sure the cable would have enough weight to feel comfortable and good rotation but it does. Seller sent email with instructions for sizing. I had forgotten how much fun jumping rope was. Great workout.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Pratt

customer_reviews.title: I would have been better off going to Toys R Us and buying a ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, awful, and overpriced. I would have been better off going to Toys R Us and buying a twine pink jump rope for 5 dollars than this. Constantly wraps into itself unless youre holding down the plastic that sticks out on each end. Poor quality and feels like the handles are going to break while you're using it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Not working well: update after its okay review
customer_reviews.text: My son insisted getting a new jump rope and came to this item. We had another heavier one that I believe is far better than any other I have seen. This one came short of this expectation. It is okay. But, IMHO, if the rope weight can increase 50%, it will be excellent. Update after one month minimal use: lost one of the screws that holds the rope with the handle two weeks ago. I tried to find a replacement crew, but it's difficult to fit well. As a result, it basically become useless now
customer_reviews.author: huaping mo

customer_reviews.title: Lasted almost 3 years then starting curling up
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginner rope to learn double unders because of the slightly heavier weight. It lasted me almost 3 years. However, it has started to curl up on it own. When you hold the rope in 2 hands, it no longer forms a nice U shape. Rather is forms a U shape with a kink. Therefore, I end up whipping myself when doing double unders. The whip marks make you look bad ass, but they really hurt. Overall, this is a reasonably priced rope great for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t love it now I do, see update.
customer_reviews.text: This is not for beginners. I totally thought this would be a great rope, given the 9000+ reviews. However when I got it, I felt like I needed a course in jumping rope. A friend gave me a simple, cheap, plastic one, and it is so easy to manage in comparison to this one. Update 8/8/2020 Ok. Fell in love with the rope. Concentrate though , got several light welts on my forearm. Speed, clean jumping.
customer_reviews.author: OA

customer_reviews.title: Worst Rope I've used
customer_reviews.text: This rope is so light. There is no substance to it so you can't really get a feel of where it's at. And when that steel cable hits you - not good. The ends pop off continuously, and there's something that's just not right with how the cable is attached to the handle - stays at a 90 degree and it just doesn't feel right. Constant stopping and restarting. Just threw it in the trash and will be getting another brand.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jump rope
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this jump rope. With my gym closed, I wanted to invest in a small amount of equipment for home workouts, but I don't have a home gym so everything needs to have a small footprint. I love how small it wraps up into the carrying bag, and it's light enough I'll be able to practice double-unders. I did trim my rope down after adjusting the collars because there was quite a bit hanging off each handle after I shortened it. This was perfect for what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Kate H

customer_reviews.title: On the Go Jump Rope
customer_reviews.text: If you're a parent or travel a lot or just have a busy lifestyle I'd definitely recommend this jump rope. It is portable, lightweight, and has a small footprint which is perfect for workouts on the go. I really like that it can be sized to a specific person's height, but I would take a time to size it in small increments so that you don't make it too short like I did. Comes with extra hardware just in case it pops off which shouldn't happen too often once you get used to jumping rope with this. I'd just tighten the thumbscrews before every session of jumping rope. Overall great product and will probably buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Randy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great jump rope for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner at jump roping. I have decided I am going to conquer this exercise and become very proficient at it. This rope is very thin and able to be spun very fast. Handles are light weight with good ball bearings and it is easy to adjust to your size/length. I will say that as a beginner some of the heavier/thicker ropes at my gym are easier for me to spin, but switching back and forth between this rope and the heavier one made spinning this one easier too, so it could just be my learning curve. All in all, a great rope for the price. Comes with a carrying bag & extra hardware!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Hate this jump rope. It get tangled up at the bottom constantly. I literally have to stop jump roping every minute to untangle this thing. It's a complete waste of my money. The reviews said this was really good and it didn't get tangled up,I'd love to know how they did that. Also I don't like the handles at all,they are so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Kalia

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, packable jump rope
customer_reviews.text: I love my new jump rope. It was very easy to adjust the length and I was able to leave the excess in place to allow it to be used by other, taller family members. It is a very small diameter cable covered in a type of plastic. It coils to a very small size and can easily fit in my carry-on when traveling. The vendors thoughtfully provide a pair of backup hardware should you lose the hardware pieces for adjusting the rope. I do recommend that one always check and then hand tighten the adjustment screw, as they have a way of loosening. I highly recommend this rope to others.
customer_reviews.author: loggerhead

customer_reviews.title: Good product - Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Used this outside for my first use, and it started to come apart. I contacted customer service and they promptly sent me a replacement (within a couple of days - free of charge). They were friendly and caring. I only jump rope inside my gym, but wanted extra practice outside the gym at my own home which I have to do outside. Apparently, the outside surface is too hard for this kind of jump rope and even looking online with other jump ropes when using outdoors, people use yoga mats or some other kind of surface to prevent this from happening. It's super lightweight, so I hope this will help my footwork and cardio for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I think this would be good for someone who had some skill in jump roping as a workout. I had never done it as a work out and this rope wasn't heavy enough for me. It whipped my legs and left welts when I didn't jump correctly. I think beginners need a heavier, softer rope. This is for advanced jumpers. I did like that it swiveled at the handles, so nothing ever got twisted up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I own it but I'd suggest you find something else
customer_reviews.text: I've got mixed feelings on this jump rope. It still works for me. Whips like a son of a gun if you miss a jump and it hits your skin. My problem is with the design, there is a locking mechanism that allows the rope to spin around the handle. But if the locking mechanism loosens, the spinning section will slide down and f*** up the jumping process. Long story short. I own it and make it work. But steer clear
customer_reviews.author: Dude-buyer3478

customer_reviews.title: CrossFit 18.3 The Double Under Workout
customer_reviews.text: I'm doing the CrossFit Open 2018. The 18.3 workout included double unders. Before today I could only do about 5 double unders in 10 minutes of practice. They are incredibly hard for me, a 59 year old who is fairly new to CrossFit. So I decided for the 18.3 workout I'd get a new rope and I got this one. I did 104, I repeat 104 double unders in 14 minutes. WOW. This is a great rope.
customer_reviews.author: hug

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this rope. It worked well for the first 4-5 workouts, but then it had exposed wire at the bottom. I do use it in a parking lot, so the ground is a little rougher. May be fine on hardwood etc. The plastic piece that attaches the handle to the rope snapped in the middle of jumping. Also, you Really Need to tighten the screws down or the rope will fly off the end of the handle and you will lose the screw that "held it". They do include a couple more screws for that reason I guess. It was very inexpensive, so I guess I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: AVOID. Very cheap feeling plastic, will not last, and returning would cost me $6.57 shipping at the cheapest
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is bottom of the barrel, cheap, prone to quickly breaking, especially the rotating part that holds the cord. As soon as I felt it, I wanted to return it, but the only return options will cost $6.57 for a refund amount of only a few bucks!!!! I can go to the post office and mail it back for under $3, so why this upcharge? This is a dollar store quality jump rope.
customer_reviews.author: LowSpender

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great. One flaw.
customer_reviews.text: So I love this rope in a lot of ways. It’s fast and easy. Adjusting it was simple. Remember to tighten the screws every time you jump, I did have a screw go flying, but, they smartly included extras. The only thing I don’t like is there is a kink at the very center. Once there is a bend or kink, it won’t come out. So, it twists super easy. There will be no crosses for me. I think that’s the one trick this rope isn’t designed for. That being said, I bought 3 ropes and this is the one I use, I gave the others to the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Dokotoch

customer_reviews.title: Definite must for serious athletes !!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these so both my kids can train for upcoming seasons, My son is 6' 3" and my daughter is 5' 1", so right out of the box the length was perfect for him and it took me about 2 minutes to adjust, cut and reapply the protective cap and they were off and training. The fact that this cable never tangles make it easier for him to train with his long legs. I highly recommend this for any one that is serious about training
customer_reviews.author: scb

customer_reviews.title: I'm 6'4" and this rope is of perfect length. For those that are shorter
customer_reviews.text: My challenge with Jump Ropes are the length and coiling of the rope. To all the tall folks out there... This is your rope. No ducking or head smacking here. I'm 6'4" and this rope is of perfect length. For those that are shorter, don't fret as the rope can be adjusted to any length. The quality of this rope is excellent, it feels swift, light , and solid. I like it so much that I'm buying another one and gifting one to my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sporting good for cardio
customer_reviews.text: Jumping rope is the perfect one for cardio exercise. Even when I was in a very small and isolated barrack in Korean Army 20 years ago, I could do the jumping rope almost every single day. You cannot make any excuse that there is no space to do this workout. This rope is very convenient to carry and the weight is also very light to wind. Actually the rope is pretty stiff but I guess the purpose is not to be tangled. It works !
customer_reviews.author: Winston Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice rope
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cable rope and works as described. I give 4 for durability just because I haven't had it long enough to be sure of its long term durability. The tips the cable runs through are plastic and that's the only part that concerns me for long term performance. This is the same with the Rogue ropes and they hold up great so I expect nothing less from this one. Its hard to beat for $10!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fun times

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rope for beginners and more advanced speed jumpers
customer_reviews.text: This is my first "adult/fitness" jump rope and I believe I made a great choice! The rope is of very high quality and for the price is certainly unbeatable. I like style of the rope bearings and the fact that it doesn't look or feel like a toy. The rope doesn't kink easily and is very fast and smooth when used in the traditional skipping/hopping fashion, though its not the best for crossovers. I did find the rope to be a little long - and I am 5' 10". Definitely only for use outside or with vaulted ceilings. The seller was great also, sending various emails to make sure I was satisfied and they showed their passion for their product.
customer_reviews.author: Smoko

customer_reviews.title: Get yo fitness on
customer_reviews.text: This is my husband’s favorite piece of workout equipment. Very durable easy to use easy to adjust. I’m 5’3 he’s a 6’4” Samsquantch and we both have no problems. If you are also married to a Samsquantch buy this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: No pain, no gain. Literally
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not for beginner. The string is too thin. This is not to be use outdoor. I can see the rubber coating being sand away as i use it on the drive way. Use it on a smooth surface. Also, unless you are good at jumping rope OR like pain, wear long pants and long sleeves. It hurt like a motherf**** whem you get whip while jumping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thankful as my friend's seemed pretty flimsy. Tried using his
customer_reviews.text: Ordered with a friend, and I never received mine. Thankful as my friend's seemed pretty flimsy. Tried using his, and I couldn't get a consistent jump with it. I typically jump rope for 20~30minutes a day so it's not like I struggle with this exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Oh

customer_reviews.title: Your new favorite jump rope!
customer_reviews.text: This jump rope is great! I love that the rope is so thin and can move quickly. I had a rope before this one that was maybe twice as thick and I can see how much faster this one moves through the air. I like that the size is quickly adjustable and you only need a wire cutter to adjust it to your height. There are bearings in the handles, which are small and light which is also a big plus. The only downside is because it moves so fast, if you don't keep up, you're going to get stung. I guess that's incentive to pay attention, and stay focused in your workout, right?
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice jump rope, but don't understand assembly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great jump rope, but should come with some instructions for how to put it together. I know that sounds silly, but an email I received mentioned putting the rope through the handle. How? I understand the cap comes off the end of the rope, but there is no hole at the end of the handle, just a screw with a hole in it. Right now, I have the cord threaded through the screw at the bottom of the handle, which leaves a bunch of overhang. It performs well, but the overhang is annoying. Help!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Yeoman

customer_reviews.title: This rope is garbage
customer_reviews.text: This jump rope is not adjustable and is not made with women in mind. I’m 5’5, taller than the average woman, and after trying to adjust this rope for my height, the extra rope on either side is so long, you can’t jump with it. I gave this rope three days of trying to adjust and the plastic around the wire is already fraying. This rope will go to the garbage, and I will continue to use my plastic rope that I’ve had for nine years.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer DeJesus

customer_reviews.title: Seems good, but one noteworthy flaw
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good jump rope, but has one fatal flaw IMO: the rope is connected to the handles via a little rubber nub that’s held on by friction alone. It took all of 3-4 sessions for the nub to pop off, go flying into parts unknown, and render the jump rope useless. If you don’t mind questing for the rubber nub every few sessions, prolly a good solution.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cave

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, not for tricks.
customer_reviews.text: Returning Item. Looks like it will last a long time but I would not recommend buying this if you want to do more than jump rope forward and back. If you plan to do any tricks, this is not the rope. I could hardly do any cross-overs as the rope is too elastic/springy. It is basically a thin (but sturdy) cable with a layer of plastic around it. I feel like it keeps a bit of bend in it while jumping, more bend than a normal rope, which is bad for tricks and such. It is very lightweight so you can't quickly accelerate into a double-under, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and wears quickly
customer_reviews.text: I used this rope twice a week for eight weeks, no more than 10 minutes at a time. The thin plastic started to peel almost immediately and the thin metal wire underneath unraveled which left painful scratches and caught on fabric and hair. The screws on the ends loosened and released the rope constantly. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: The plastic coating broke off the rope the first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: It was a waste of money ... and though it was inexpensive, it is still a waste of the time to get it here and then being able to use it one time before the plastic came off of the wire. If it would not have broken, it is noteworthy that the 'rope' section is VERY VERY fine - not like any jumprope I've used or seen. This may be the "style" now, but it doesn't hold up at all. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bentley's Folks

customer_reviews.title: Good Xfit rope
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight rope but it hurts when/if it hits your legs. It is just like the ropes we have in Crossfit. The only downside was trying to cut it down to size. You need some kind of thick cable cutters. I didn't cut off enough but I am not going back in because it took me an hour to get off the little bit I managed to cut.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee N. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Awkward rope. Loses momentum.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. After several weeks of trying to use this, I'm just giving up. The rope is awkward and will randomly start to lose it's momentum as your jumping. You then have to try to muscle it around more or adjust your grip which generally just screws up your rhythm. Every time you screw up, when this thing clips your foot, it whips around and smacks your arm, which over time gets really annoying because the thing won't spin correctly.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but quickly fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to try a new jump rope, and after first using FMS International's, I was really blown away. However, I only managed to use it about four times - each session I jumped about a half hour at a decent speed on concrete. After the fourth time using the rope, the plastic covering completely frayed and exposed the wire underneath, which also started to expose some sharp ends. I was disappointed that the rope lasted so little time. On a side note, it was cool to see sparks under my feet while jumping, but that probably was not the seller's intention.
customer_reviews.author: James Christ

customer_reviews.title: It's an excellent little jump rope
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent little jump rope, my only frustration is that in order to get it to the length you need, you have to cut it. Cutting it was tricky, I had to pester 3 different people before someone could score me something strong enough to cut through it. Cutting it is also permanent.. So folks don't make the same mistake I did - I cut it like.. an inch to short and now I can't use it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Mcbunny

customer_reviews.title: Not indestructible
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight and my husband who is 6’5” likes that it was a longer adjustable rope. However, underneath the coating lies a rope of death. It’s made of fibrous metal, that, inevitably hit at the ankles or the back of the ankles is not a welcoming surprise. My husband says it’s just encouragement to not get hit, but I’m not as masochistic as he is.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel R.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE. THIS. JUMPROPE.
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying this rope because of what others have said about it breaking, but I’ve had no issue at all. I adjusted the rope and clipped the excess wire with plier/wire cutters and it works great. I’ve gotten it caugh up in my feet and thrown it around...it’s hardled regular beatings well for the last few months. The rotation of the wire makes it a lot easier on your wrists than a standard rope. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Phipps

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, Horrible: Dont order this
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. It's not a jump rope. It's a garrote. The 'rope' itself is really very thin wire. It's not weighted so doesnt have anythign near a jump rope feel. A more accuarate analogy is really 'fishing line on a string'. Avoid. I'd return mine, but the $10 cost is too low to return; my time and postage isnt worth the trouble; Hence this 1 star review. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: A Guy named Mike in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: After making the mistake of buying a speed rope with metal handles, I am happy to say that this speed rope is perfect for Double Unders and a great low-cost piece of equipment to add to your HIIT or Crossfit gear. Handles are plastic, but relatively durable. Bearings seem to be pretty smooth and the rope turns plenty fast for DU's (or TU's if you're a stud). Clasps on this model seem to keep secure even when you biff and whip yourself. Perfect rope to add to your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long, hard to single/double under with and slashes really hurtful
customer_reviews.text: Anyone shorter than 6' needs to cut it for "adjustment" (me 5'7'' and 1' cut) and if you can do that you can probably steal a bike with ease Yet it's super easy to get caught when double swing with any deviation from the perfect tempo. Never held to 1 min with it and always ended up with a hard slash Anyway it popped its cap so I rage threw it in trash can maybe worth 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Good if you're extremely tall and like getting welts
customer_reviews.text: These will work for you if your 7 feet tall and like having your fingers crushed if you mess up. The coating on the cable is extremely durable but to a fault. If you try getting adventurous and mess up the cable snaps back so hard and leaves welts on your hands. Also, yes, it is adjustable but if you're a short girl or on the shorter side for a guy like me (5'8) this rope is so long that when you try to adjust it to fit there is so much extra floppy cable hitting your hands. Not bad but I wasn't a fan of it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner rope and even better price!
customer_reviews.text: Good beginner rope. It's pretty light but had enough thickness to allow me to string DUs for the first time. I had been using the crappy gym ropes which were hella light. Handles feel hollow but work fine. Bearings are smooth. Hardware is holding up well but in only use it once or twice a week for 3-5 minutes. For $6, it's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Miz Booshi

customer_reviews.title: This will speed your jumping even more than a speed rope
customer_reviews.text: This sucker is light and really gets one jumping quickly, even compared to the typical “speed ropes”. The gimbal joints in the handles are the difference. I’m a bit leery of its long term durability (and even though I’m happy they sent spares for the screw-down handle connectors, the fact that we need those makes me worry). So far so good though. The carrying case is a nice touch, which I think will help keep it in better shape.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Junk pos cheap jump rope. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The most garbage, and cheap product sold on amazon. Amazon remove this pos. The materials are so cheap, the handles will not even stay on. This is an absolute JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Jmyu

customer_reviews.title: the covering tore
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cannot beat them! my only complaint is i use this on a concrete pad and after about a month the covering of the wire started to wear and when that happens it doesnt work as well as it should so i had to buy another and yet again after a month the covering wore off. if you are using this in a gym than you should be ok but i guess the roughness of the concrete just wore it down so the cable was exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Sargent Dude

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking. There are better options.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because of the great reviews on here. Once it arrived and I took it out of the packaging, I discovered that it was made of cheap plastic and an extremely small diameter length of cable that has no weight and tangles itself during workout. I'm going to do what I should've done and go to my local Academy and try to find a suitable rope to begin my workouts and get in shape.
customer_reviews.author: Justin H.

customer_reviews.title: not recommended
customer_reviews.text: One of the jump rope (blue one) came out defective. Theres some wires sticking out by the handles. This is my 2nd time using it. Unfortunately I found the hard way as I cut my finger open. I have the other one that I can use for now. But definitely will be contacting seller to request a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Zhu

customer_reviews.title: I am happy as a clam with the rope
customer_reviews.text: Almost bought a $35 rope from Onnit. thank god I looked on Amazon! I'm 5'4 and the rope was too long for me as is, even with the ability to adjust. So I had to cut some of it off. I, unfortunately, just moved across country and didn't bring any tools with me. I used a pair of scissors (probably ruined them) but it worked. I am happy as a clam with the rope! :) But when buying, know you'll need cutting pliers unless you're tall!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Choi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust the screws, then it rotates with a great experience
customer_reviews.text: This jump rope rocks. The design of the adjustable screws causes the rope to rotate in a really smooth way, and I like it far more than my other traditional jump rope (where the rope starts at the handles and rotates around that point). This rope is so light and thin that it's perfect for trying sprints or double-unders. It takes ~5 minutes to adjust the screws to the right height, and then this rope is ready for many great workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio in TX

customer_reviews.title: Great length :/
customer_reviews.text: I have welts all over my arms from whipping tf out of myself jumping rope which is why I would not recommend this for beginners. At one point, I stopped on the rope and the handle broke a part. I was able to put it back together but it didn't make me feel very good that it happened the first time using it so I returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Dunn

customer_reviews.title: cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.text: ends came off with first use.. thumbscrew pieces and rubber tip were so small i couldn't find it.. that's why they include a bag of replacement parts..so now if it comes off again its useless. its made of thin plastic and shouldnt be used on concrete or pavement.. after one use you know its going to fray and break in time.. this is not for serious training
customer_reviews.author: VIP808

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This jump rope is very lightweight and "fast". If you're not "skilled" I wouldn't suggest it because when it hits you it's like a whip. Also the handle design makes it possible for it to come apart mid jump if that screw loosens. Which is what happened to me. And I lost the screw in the gym
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to learn Double Unders
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty stupid and used these on concrete. The rubber around the metal bands is not meant for that. It shredded pretty quickly at the bottom. If I'm outside I lay an outdoor mat below me. I went from no experience to 30 double unders in a row with these in about three months. So there is no excuse with the rope or mechanisms not being good enough to do fast jumping. Good product. Just be careful to continually tighten the screws as I lost a pair and had to resort to backup.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Best Jump Rope I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I wasn't sure what to expect with this jump rope. I had my last rope for a few years before it snapped on one of the handles. I have complete confidence that this cable wire jump rope is going to last through many future sessions. Besides the quality of materials, it is certainly the most balanced in terms of optimal weight and it's incredibly easy to get into a good rhythm while using this rope.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a week
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jump rope because of the price about a month ago. It was a good, easy to handle, easy to carry, and adjustable rope. But then it broke within a week. The handles came off mid exercise. I should have returned it but instead I just tied the loose ends and worked with it. However, two months in they broke again to the point I can't fix it. I see the reviews here are decent for the rope so maybe I was one of the unlucky few that got a faulty rope but I was disappointed to say the least and hope the company double checks their rope quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: why is it so hard to get a good reliable set of jump ropes these days?
customer_reviews.text: After using these again I remember why I hate them. after a couple hundred jumps something sticks here, or it wobbles there, or slides here. Man, just give me a BASIC RELIABLE construction. Keep putting in all these parts and adjustable settings and things fail. Throwing in the trash and trying again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Jump Rope
customer_reviews.text: So if you're used to the old rope or material style jump rope, this is truly a fantastic beginner rope. It works very well. It is not weighted and is very light so if you are new to this form of exercise you will love this rope. If you have been jumping rope for a long time you will want to get a heaver setup. As an amateur myself I gave it 5 stars but I am sure I will need to upgrade to a heavier rope soon because I am already pretty athletic.
customer_reviews.author: Al Tone

customer_reviews.title: Amazing rope for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing rope, works fine. I am beginner and it made it easy fine tune my rhythm. I am still learning. What I like about it 1- extremely portable. 2- very fast response. 3-the customer service is awesome. They were following up with me to make sure I am 100% satisfied with it. 4- the price is amazing. What I don't like about it. 1- it is very difficult to cut it with regular wire cutters. 2- it is all made of plastic. It can break if it wasn't treated well. Will update if something new came up.
customer_reviews.author: rnoor

customer_reviews.title: Reading the reviews I assumed that it was a good choice. I received a nice little email talking ...
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews I assumed that it was a good choice. I received a nice little email talking about its quality and all this other B.S. If this jump rope is lacking one thing it is quality! The handle in plastic and hollow, with not much weight behind it. It's made very cheaply and is very ineffective for maintaining movement. I would strongly suggest spending an extra $5 and getting a jump rope with the larger ball bearing handles. This thing is trash.
customer_reviews.author: austin

customer_reviews.title: More of a construction project than a jump rope.
customer_reviews.text: Jump rope came dissembled with no instructions how to assemble or which side of the handle to screw the hardware on. I had to refer to the amazon ad. I haven't even used it yet and I can tell it wont last long. Its the thinnest jump rope I've ever seen, im sure the lining of the rope will wear away within a month. Oh and Im 6' 5" and this jump rope is too big for me! I can only imagine the problems others will face. I would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: sandythatsme

customer_reviews.title: Speed Training for Taekwondo
customer_reviews.text: *update : blisters on palm :-( My husband purchased one for him and one for my 9year old. It can be adjusted to desired length. They use it everyday to train and per my little one, the handles are easy to hold, don’t slip and not make his hands sweaty. Happy with the purchase, considering it’s one of the cheaper ones you can find online
customer_reviews.author: K and Tembs

customer_reviews.title: great for crossfit!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving my new jump rope. It is very easy to adjust. Works great for doubleunders . It came with a great travel bag that makes it easy to carry into the gym or wherever. These are lightweight and appear that they will last a long while. I plan on purchasing a pair for my boyfriend.
customer_reviews.author: serena

customer_reviews.title: great jumprope
customer_reviews.text: This Speed Jumprope was ordered for my 15 year old son, who got too tall for his previous jumprope. Very good jumprope for someone who wants a good jumprope for training. He uses it to help prepare for high school tennis. Able to adjust to make correct length. Product was delivered when promised.
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: Great Rope
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a week now but I love it. I was using the ropes at the gym but people were always busting the handles, or tying the cable (which kinks it and warped links cables after untying) , or not putting them back. It took a while to get used to it spinning easier than the other ropes because of the bearings but it was also nice having a rope the right length. Probably jumped a total of 1 hour and 20 minutes and it's going well. There are 1 star reviews about the handles breaking but for $10 I'd buy another one if this one broke, especially compared to how much other people charge for a rope
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Emmel

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional but these ropes are way too light to skip. If you are a beginner, these may be good to start with. But, someone who can go unbroken for 400-500 jumps, not for them. These get stuck, too flimsy and you loose control when they reach the bottom of your feet.
customer_reviews.author: MK Amazon fan

product_meta.title: Survival and Cross Jump Rope - Boxing MMA Fitness Training - Speed Adjustable - Sold by FMS International
feature_bullets: FULLY ADJUSTABLE - The Survival and Cross Jump Rope is Built with 5 Inch Handles and Ten Foot Cable and is Fully Adjustable to Provide a Speed and Endurance Workout for Adults of All Sizes

EASY TO USE - Great for beginners as well as the most experienced jump rope athletes to rock your first ever double unders or set a new personal record - from casual skipping rope to serious jump rope training this rope has you covered.
LIGHT AND FAST - Lightweight handles, tangle and twist free coated steel cable, ball bearings for proper rotation, smooth motion and super fast speeds for light warm-ups to grueling cardio routines.

COMPACT AND EASY TO CARRY - Never have an excuse to ever miss a workout again, so light and easy to carry with you anywhere and everywhere, fits easily in a backpack, briefcase or purse that you can get in a workout anytime and anywhere.

LIFETIME GUARANTEE - No worries or hassles with your purchase, if you ever have any issue with your jump rope for any reason just contact our support team and we will send you a new jump rope for free, no catches or strings attached.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
